content.prompt: ​A ball is dropped from a height of 10{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} feet. The ball repeatedly bounces, and the maximum height of the ball after each bounce is 20%{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} less than the previous maximum height. Which of the following arguments is correct regarding a sequence that can be used to model the successive maximum heights, in feet?

choices.label: ​An arithmetic sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by subtracting 2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the previous height.
​An arithmetic sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by multiplying the previous height by 0.8{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.
​​A geometric sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by subtracting 2{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"} from the previous height.
​​A geometric sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by multiplying the previous height by 0.8{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}.

topic.text: 2.1: Change in Arithmetic and Geometric Sequences
